title: Totally I am in love with it
Honest review for lenovo k8 note
Two Stars
Killer note 👌
Just go for it....

Value for money !
It is a good phone. Works fine
Lenovo K8 Note 2 day review
Value for Money
review:
Totally I am in love with it. Call quality, network access, internet, battery,
charging time etc. absolutely love it. Camera front is impressive but the rear
camera is a little disappointing in case you are using a depth enabled mode
shot or low light shot. I am still using it and will soon update my
experience.

Hi  
Check my honest review  
  
In day to day life it's best phone to use. But battery life is issue with
heavy users, some lag will be seen also by me like keyboard is also hang up.
And phone is giving awesome performance. Camera is pretty good in outdoor
lighting conditions. Lenovo is doing pretty well with this kind of budget
phone.  
  
This much features with price of 14000 is absolutely acceptable.  
  
I am quite satisfied with phone.

Overall phone is good, but Camera quality is worst.  
8 megapixel Camera is just better than Lenovo ki Note

This is the honest review I m giving after using this phone for 2-3 weeks,
first of all , let's talk about camera the depth enabled mode(dual camera)
doesn't meets my expectations, and results of back camera is ok ok let's say
only good ! Nothing special but very satisfied with the front camera . Even in
low light ,it captures good pictures , now the battery life is good (as it's
4000mah) but sometimes it drains very rapidly even without heavy usage and
sometimes it drains very slowly even in heavy usage! LoL, let me mention one
thing that it's rapid charger not fast charger, it takes almost 2hrs to charge
from 0-100 only when ur not connected to any internet network or not using ,,
otherwise it takes more than 4hrs , and this isn't mentioned anywhere that I
am going to tell u that when u play video with quality 360p or less than that
or 420p or less than that it looks worst ! Ssly worst !! Other specifications
are at it's top ! 4gb ram and 64gb rom with 10 core processor it doesn't lag
at all no matter what u do ! Overall the device is good , near to awesome if
keep it's price range in mind ! I suggest u to buy this device if the above
mentioned cons doesn't matters to you !

The best all round performance you can find in this price range.  
Now for Pros n Cons....  
Everybody knows the Pros,but let me share the cons which I feel very annoying  
Firstly the screen- random application gets opened as you speak over the phn,I
mean the screen responds to even ear touch,inspite the proximity sensor
working just fine.  
Secondly the dual camera...USE IT ONLY DURING DAYLIGHT....The camera performs
misserably under low-light conditions,More over there is no stabilization on
offer,getting good photos out of this...Hmmm u just have to depend on nature.  
Well I guess both these cons can be solved by an update.  
So just deducted a star.

Not very satisfied with it, it just capture some good images, apart that
nothing is good in this phone..sometimes lags too much, msgs just gone
disppear for while, sometimes doesnt show the contact Name, sometimes doesnt
open the required app..before this phone. i was using Lenovo P2, i thought,
lenovo has upgraded this phn with some extraordinary apps, but this phone
dissapointed me..

HD display, along with free cover, deca core, 4gb ram, dual camera, selfie
flash, separate sd card slot along with dual SIM and of course 5.5 inches...
Complete package in this cost.

It is a good phone.Works fine.Display is sharp.Speakers are loud and
clear.Camera quality is okay,but not everyone is a social media addict.  
It is good value for Money.However the phone itself doesnt come with any
freebies.There were no headphones.  
What i would like to point out is that the headphone it supports are 3.5mm
jack but not every headphone on the street works on it.I had to search quite a
bit to get an ideal headphone.It takes a bit of an effort to shove the
headphone in,You may feel you are damaging the phone...  
I would say it is great value for money and a bit more reliable than xiomi.

I have been using this phone for 2 days now, so I haven't explored all the
features of this phone completely as yet.  
  
Good Things:  
1\. Charging is fast considering this to be a 4000 mAH battery.  
2\. Sound quality is good, especially on good quality earphones.  
  
Not so good:  
1\. This is not a 4G + 4G dual standby phone as mentioned in the description.
The SIM you select for your data becomes 4G. The other can best support 3G. So
if you have Jio SIM and it is not selected for data, then that SIM just
switches off.  
2\. Stock android will take some time to get used to. Missed apps for Music
Player, Photo Gallery that come pre-bundled with other phones.  
3\. Photos are not great but of good quality.  
  
Overall satisfied with the purchase.

So far so good ... Have been a Lenovo user for a while . The phone does not
disappoint... It is for sure value for money. Just one issue , I am unable to
record calls on the go . Please do not buy it for the camera . Otherwise it
will take care of your basic daily requirements for a phone

Good performance but heats up quickly.....Charging too slow...Shows 6 hrs
until full even with turbo charger

An amazing phone....  
Pros-  
1\. Excellent cameras (both front selfie camera & rear primary camera) in this
price range. Even low light photography using flash in both the cameras was
far better than other phones in the 15k range. The camera is fast and very
responsive.  
2\. A superfast phone for people who multitask a lot. Didn't even hang with
heavy online gaming.  
3\. Superb battery backup. Even with the data continuously on and continuous
gaming the battery gives a backup of more than 6 hrs. Lasts more than 12 hrs
with normal usage. And with the turbo charging feature the phone charges real
fast.  
4\. The phone has a premium look.  
5\. Comes with preloaded Microsoft office package.  
  
Cons-  
1\. Is the company fooling us by saying that it's a Gorilla glass????? My
phone fell lightly from less than a feet and the display got shattered.

Got my lenovo K8 note next day of my ordering.  
  
The screen has superb look and feel.  
  
The amazing part is battery and turbo charging.  
  
All the apps from my old android phone were transferred easily to new phone.  
  
Camera is great, Sound is good and the system is quick and responsive.  
  
Happy to have selected this phone.  
  
Only difficulty I have faced is to cast screen to my Tv

Lenovo K8 Note - Battery discharging quick when net is in ON condition and
phone not used (kept ideal), There is no default call recording option in this
model alone  
Am purchased this Lenovo K8 Note mobile through online (Amazon) on 09.10.2017.
Following problems are noticed,  
1.Battery discharging quick when net is in ON condition but phone not used
(kept ideal),  
2.There is no default call recording option in this model alone whereas other
models have this option.  
Actually am planned to purchase this phone brand (Lenovo K8) for think of this
option & 4000MAH battery only. I couldn't see this mobile demo before purchase
because this is online purchase model.  
But now am facing difficulty. Expecting a software upgrade with default call
recording option (as like other models) and suggestions for Battery saving.

One of the best budget phone to buy in around 14k  
Have been using this phone from one month & haven't received any problems in
particular.  
Sound is good & camera quality is also nice.  
Battery back is superb & needs charging only once in whole day.  
Selfie camera is good & along with moon light flash it works great even in low
light.  
Apps run quickly & dnt get hang in between.  
Overall a great phone to buy.

I am posting this review after 3 months of usage.  
Initially the phone looked good, but as i started using i found many problems.  
1\. If you go to contacts and click on any contact the screen goes blank and
you cant open the contact.  
2\. Mirroring function is not there, so if you want to do mirroring on your TV
or projector its not possible  
3\. Bluetooth doesnt work, the phone is not searchable by any other bluetooth
device or it cant search any active bluetooth device  
4\. Camara is ok nothing great to have duar camara at the back, and front
camara has average result.  
5\. Charging takes long time in some sockets, dont know why.  
6\. Front sensorts are not that great.  
  
My overall verdict is if you can get a better option at this price then go for
it.

You will love music wen u hear with your headphones ,

I have always been using high end smart phone. Before this I was using Google Pixel ...
review:
This is very unlike of mediatek processor device. It has 10 cores which runs
just fine.  
Overall good phone, with good display.  
Camera images with dual camera depth looks somewhat like software depth rather
than hardware depth from dual cameras. But overall pic quality is nice.  
Heavier in weight a bit and It feels so. Mi note 4 is lighter than this.
Perhaps some work needed there.  
Less bloatwares, nice performance.  
Aspect ratio is a turn off. These days 18:9 is popular, but this phone has
unwanted space near earpiece. A lot actually. And software navigation buttons
could have reduced weight, improved aspects ratio.  
Price is perfect.  
I could see too much gap or a black gap line between screen boundaries and
bezels. This black gap makes you feel odd but it's not much of a problem.  
Sound is good. Speed is okay, looks value for money.

Excelent delivery & team is good followup with customer, msg update time to
time. happy with this product. 😃. Issue of Cast Screen is not functionable,
Ringing Volume is common for notification msg. also. Inbuilt Call Recorder
function is not available. Plastic Back Cover Quality is so much of worst.

Package arrived well before the time promised.  
Package was in nice condition.delivery boy asked to open the parcle and check
whether everything is right or not.  
Now about the product. ...  
Everything is just as promised but the battery life is not up to the mark as a
4000 mah battery should be.  
Gets a little bit worm while charging. .overall performance is good.  
Both the Camera are also good.feels solid in hand...a bit slipry...  
My vote is 9.5 out of 10  
.5 deducted for battery.

Using this phone for almost 3 months, now i believe i can give u a fair
review.  
I got this one for 12300 due to some cashback with HDFC Credit Card.  
And with that money segment i will say it is a very good buy.  
1) I never felt the heating problem, even when it is charging i am using it
for heavy games with WIFI, it was nominal heat.  
2) There is a nominal lag in this phone, it is not that much but I was not
expecting a lit bit of delay as it is having 4GB Memory. Memory Usage in this
phone is quite poor and Lenovo should work on this one to make it a better
phone.  
3) Camera: you won't be disappointed  
4) Volte: Jio Sims work fine, Airtel 3g on sim 2 along with JIO on SIM1. so no
complain in that part  
5) Battery: Continous Consumption(Beast usage) will make the phone to dry by
10 hours, but if using wisely more than a day backup.  
6) Charging: Turbo Charging at its best, complete charging (0-100%) in 1:30
hours  
7) Speaker: Dolby Sound can't complain at all  
8) Waterproof: Survived its first Holi without any issue, DO I NEED TO SAY
MORE  
  
The Memory Management is poor in this phone which gives you lag occurrence
when you are using multiple things. But the other qualities of the phone are
more than enough to make it a must buy.

phone delivered was defective its internal speakers were not working. i have
returned it. expecting a new phone.this kind of defective phone from amazon
not at all expected. it waste of time and money.

I have always been using high end smart phone. Before this I was using Google
Pixel 128 GB.  
So  
Here is my review of this wonderful smart phone  
  
1\. Not only expensive phones are good, this affordable smart phone , I
personally find even better than Google pixel .  
2\. What you expect as far as performance , feature , battery life , ease of
use , this phone will not disappoint you.  
  
Last but not the least , I am a pro photographer, hence do not use mobile
phone camera , but the camera both rear and front did impress me too.

title: Best ever phone around 15k
Comparison between k8 Note and k8 Plus
Not working with my Jio sim
It was awesome. Everything was fine
Really good phone.
poor software support
KillerNote Should have Dual 4G Standby.
0 to 30% within 20 mins.
Lenovo K8 note feedback
Best product.
review:
Very good product at this price range . It's not like other device which has
more power only in one aspect ex: processor , battery , camera , music ,
display , built quality , storage etc. This phone is an all rounder in all
aspects & this phone belongs to an above average to flagship level category .
I would like to say it's an flagship phone in premium mid range category .
Forget about mediatek processor & compare with Redmi note 3 , you will
definitely find that this phones performance ​is far better than Redmi Note 3
due to it's 20nm processor unlike the 28nm processor of Redmi note 3 . In
comparison with Redmi note 4 , K8 Note's processor is better in performance
but note 4's processor is good in battery life & in moderate use I get minimum
9-10 hours of battery life in K8 Note .Also K8 Note comes with Turbo charger .
After a big exploration I found K8 Note is best at this time & in this price
range . I will definitely recommend this phone to anyone who wants an all
rounder phone . I gave 4 star coz of Amazon's delivery & packing otherwise
this phone deserves 5 star out of 5 .

I will not recommend this phone . Its battery back up is poor and video
quality doesn't match with the same end phones.  
  
I want to suggest buyers who are planning to buy this phone don't buy this ,,
instead of K8 Note go for K8 plus ..K8 plus and k8 note has small difference
in specs but very big differences in performance. K8 plus has good battery
life and last for almost 1 day after heavy use (in my case)., k8 note has same
4k mah battery but drains very quickly.Gaming experience quite nice on k8 plus
and k8 note both..No lags. K8 NOTE has some heating issue while charging but
k8 plus has very minor or no heating problems.I have both the phones and among
both of them k8 plus seems good to me.Thank u.

Last 4 day back i bought K8 note. but I am very upset it's not working with my
Jio sim. Mobile having heating problem also. I have put return request but
they are saying they will not refund the amount only replacement can be
placed. :(

When i got this phone, i was fully surprised. It was awesome. Everything was
fine, touch was smooth, display viewing angle was quite brilliant, video
playback was up to the mark. Having inbuilt Dolby Atmos is like butter on
bread. but after two or three hours , i noticed that , battery started
draining continously, turbo charger taking too long to charge approx 4-5 hrs
to charge from 40% to 100% . after that, it took 100% to 90% in just 10 min,
with just simple music playback, i was surprised, even battery was draining in
idle condition, i thought there might be an issue with my battery, then i
contact AMAZON SERVICE they remotely access my device and after review they
said nothing is wrong with your device. everything is fine. then i thought i
had to fix it on my own, after some tweak, it went back to the track. Now my
battery is working fine , max 7-8 hrs on heavy usage and 1.5 day on normal
usage. #satisfied.

cover.. Overally good phone in betn 20k smartphones group. I got 4gb ROM and
64gb RAM at ₹11,999. Thnku amazon

Much better phones for this price range are available in the market. Phone
switches off after getting charged, takes forever to boot up, Magic button
never worked for music but at least it's working for capturing screenshots
now.  
Though from parent company of Motorola, this doesn't get OS upgrades (it does
get updates for the same OS).  
I'm not sure if this is an Android feature or of this phone- there's no way to
forget a WiFi network AND have the phone remember not to connect to it in the
future. The phone reads an unsecured network at work and connects to it every
day even though I keep selecting "Forget network".  
Won't ever buy a Lenovo again.

Superb phone for the given price. 11700  
(13000 - 10% cashback.!)  
Though it's DUAL Camera doesn't even match iPhone 5s, it's mediatek processor
is probably one of the fastest.  
No super AMOLED but still display is great.  
Also Corning glass makes it smooth.  
Nice volumes of music!  
2 sim + 1 dedicated memory card slot  
Reliance JIO also works on it even if it shows no network..that's the biggest
advantage!  
However I was not offered insurance for the phone like we get if we were to
buy offline.  
Amazon must create this system!!  
All major games functioning!  
Many apps open at a time without slowing down  
Fingerprint sensor stops working once in a week..it starts working after
resetting the fingerprint..!  
Heating may be an issue if used much.  
Deca core 4gb + Android 8 update is added benefit!  
Battery runs 1 entire heavily used working day (office hours) (>10 hrs.)  
Lastly, to show attitude, the phone has a Nice look for show off!

review:
Best "value for money" phone out there. Also, quite good looking. It feels a
bit heavy though, but maybe it's due to the huge 4000mAh battery and Aluminium
body which are absolutely worth it. Power management is great and that adds to
the already great battery life. Just after setting up the phone it asked for
about 4 system updates, which gave it the slow motion video capture mode @720p
(it wasn't available before). The split screen mode for multitasking works
excellent. Camera quality and features are also above expectations for this
price range. The only problem is that, the sound quality is below par as it
should be with "Dolby Atmos".  
Overall, this phone is really worth buying, it has no comparison in this price
range and can even compete with the ones priced higher too.

I got this for my mom and here's what I think..  
Pros  
Nice built quality  
Includes a case in the box itself(hard transparent case)  
Display quality is also good  
Camera is also good in good lighting conditions  
Dolby Atmos also works properly and gives you a little bit of depth in the
loudspeaker.  
Battery Backup is good..  
  
Cons  
Processor is a mediocre not good, they would give this phone at least a
snapdragon 625 for performance because gaming is not that good.  
Battery Backup is good but as the phone 4000mah battery we would have also
seen some better results.  
Charging time is just little bit faster than normal charger.  
Gets a little warm while continue using it for like gaming or multitasking.  
If you find it useful than please like it.

Good phone in its price range. Stock Android does the job nicely. The camera
is good and battery life is excellent. The turbo charger is effective. Was
first delivered a phone with faulty camera. I initiated the replacement. The
engineer visited home to check the mobile. Got a replacement phone within a
week. Liked the promptness shown by Amazon.

I am a movie lover. Wanted to watch them on my big TV screen by casting them
from my new K8 note. I have an android TV box - not chrome cast  
There is a option in phone to cast under display,but disappointingly the phone
could not find the TV.  
To me this a major draw back. It may not be a serious issue for those who do
not use mirroring.  
Worst thing was when I wanted a solution from Lenovo team through live chat,
the person who was chatting, one Mr Saleem says K8 can cast only through
chrome cast.further when I was typing my next question, he abruptly
disconnected.  
There are also lot many posts by several users complaining about the casting
issue on K8 note.

I was preparing a lot for this buy. I am not a heavy user. But see a lot of
videos and listens to music too. Screen size is perfect. Battery life is
descent. Clarity of photographs is excellent.

This phone is great in terms of daily usage and doing muti task.  
The screen is crisp and bright, and is full HD so the pixel per inch is also
pretty good.  
It has Dolby surround sound and it is pretty good for a phone at this price.  
The dual camera's does a decent job indoors and captures some crisp pictures
in good lighting conditions.  
The battery lasts a whole day easily so that too is not a problem.  
The competition for this phone comes in the form of redmi note 5 and Moto g5s
plus.  
So you could go for it.

I was using note 5 and had loved it. I used for a year and half, never faced
any issues in any areas.. based on this I bought note 8, but it's not up to
the mark. There are many problems with this phone..  
  
1\. Didn't understand the duel sim technology. If am on a call I don't get
internet. It's not compatible.  
2\. Within a month charging cable stopped working.  
3\. There is no auto call recorder like note 5.  
4\. Other things too but I am lazy to write.  
  
I was so much fan of lenovo that I bought same for my mom.

If you are looking this phone, phone have 10 core MediaTek processor which can
give very good performance as compared to a Snapdragon 625 but the camera of
this phone is little compromise because it have a dual setup of camera and the
photo which is in portrait or depth mode is not quite good as compared to
portrait mode camera which is having dual camera compare with MI A1 so if you
want good performance in games and some dual portrait mode photos you can buy
this phone in very good price

Loved it .  
  
Hands a few times while playing games. But that's ok (I can live with it)  
  
Speakers could have been a wee bit louder, but I normally use Bluetooth
headphones, so it really doesn't matter.  
  
The stock OS , was not very pleasing to the eyes nor was it mouldable. So I
had to overlay third party launcher. And now I'm quite happy.

The features are excellent but the usability isn't there. Despite a 10-core
processor, 4 GB of RAM, it hangs out quite frequently. I have an old Huawei
Honor 6, 3 GB RAM - 2015 model, which is better than the new device. Also
applications keeps on crashing quite frequently.  
  
Camera is of not good use too. The pixel clarity is inefficient as it gets
blur upon zooming (after clicking of photographs). Also the time taken for
saving the picture is +3 seconds after the click, which is quite high as I
have never used such a slow camera in any phone.  
  
Battery life is good. With constant data, frequent calling and mail checks, it
runs for 8-10 hrs. Also turbo charger is a great advantage.  
  
Speakers are another strong point in the phone. The sounds are great, means
comparable or better than my Vaio Laptop.  
  
The phone boosts of Gorilla Glass, but got scratch within a week of use while
keeping it in pocket only.  
  
Lenovo doesn't have any Gallery or Music Player apps, so had to download it
from google play, which again either comes with advertisements or I need to
purchase those. Hence, I am stuck with the advertised versions of basic apps.
Also, had purchased New System Updates, still had to update 2 GB of updates in
total 3 times. Still Oreo update would be available only in June/July.  
  
The worst part is I had gifted it to my wife, and now what I got in return is
the complaints part, that too all the time. Means despite spending 10k
approx., this device does not fulfil its advertised words.
